title: Banning System Actually Improved??
body:
Hey,

I recently popped onto a smurf, 5 man queued normals and picked Tryndamere middle. The enemy team killed me once and they started to say  'ez' and all of that, so I decided to start flaming in a joking way along with my friends. We ended up winning and I got off the game. Like an hour later when my friends wanted to play again, so I popped back onto my smurf, and boom. 14 day ban.

I'm not complaining or anything, just suprised. Good job Riot.

Cheers.

replies.body:
It's a common misconception that Riot's punishment systems have major flaws. They do have flaws, but it's (mostly) minor (and that exists with any system, manual *or* automated). One of the issues with the way Riot's punishment systems work is that there's little feedback to the community so that people know it's working, and as it should be. The Instant Feedback System was implemented to help with that, but it has yet to reach it's full potential. As it stands, usually the only person to receive the notification that someone they reported was banned is the person who submitted the most recent report when the punishment was applied. Riot planned to spread it around a bit more, however there hasn't been any news on that (at least not that I've seen).

One of the other things to consider is that people will generally focus on the negatives and ignore the positives. This means that, when they complain about the negative aspects, they're misrepresenting the whole picture, which they believe to be mostly/all negative when it's likely a lot more "balanced" (around 50-50) or skewed towards positive.

Another thing to consider is that each person has a different experience in-game. Some people have more negative experiences, and those are the people who are most likely to speak up, while others will have more positive, or even neutral, experiences, and those people don't really have reason to speak up. For example, I see a lot of people consistently complaining of troublesome players on the boards, yet, personally, I rarely have any such problems, and they're usually pretty benign. To put it simply, the people I see complaining have more negative experiences while I have more neutral/positive experiences (at least when it comes to the behaviour of other players).
Straight to a 14 day ban? Did you have any other punishments on that account beforehand?
yeah it has definitely improved haha, i got banned 2 weeks ago for a 14 day ban for toxicity :p i get it back today

I love it when trolls say in game they won't get banned and I tell them they will :P

I would pay to see your face when you got banned :)
